content.description: Climb the most open looking slab on the more eastern aspect of the wall closer to the road. Go right from the weir and up and back left to a platform often used for primitive camping. Look for the bolts and you are there.
content.location: Upper right of the wall, more facing the road.

content.description: Climb the obvious finger crack up further right from the wall low point with a bouldery starting section that eases off fairly quickly from there and cut out left on good features to the anchors
Right side of upper ramp at top of the wall. Left of 2 obvious corners with cracks.

While Osprey in Shining Armor heads to bolts off the anchors up on the ledge at the end of the crag and bolted corner above, this is to the right on the ledge and heads up to a short corner before following another bolted that joins Osprey above.
content.location: Right side of ledge at downstream end of crag

content.description: Follow a steeper corner right of the ramp of Dream of Wild Osprey and continue up the face off the middle of angling ledge with a steeper start.
content.location: Just right of the wall low point

content.description: Layback up a right-trending ramp to face climbing with huge jugs to the crux, a tough mantle move over a steep slab.
content.protection: Bolts protecting face moves, plenty of gear options for the beginning lieback section and in other cracks throughout the climb. 2 bolt anchor at top
content.location: Begins at obvious large right-trending pointy block/ramp, look for bolts above. Belayer will be near a huge block that's halfway in the creek.

content.description: Follow the bolt line at the end of the crag, up on the ledge before the creek drop off, going all the way to the ramp above or ending at anchors.
Right of the 2 crack corners at the right end of the upper wall. More fun than left corner but could use more ascents to clean it up a bit!
content.protection: Gear, couple or so 3" and a 4"+ needed
content.location: Upstream end of the upper wall up short vertical corner

content.description: Follow the 25' larger ramp corner in the middle of the base up to an angling ledge. From here continue up bolts and good hole features to the finish or just cut out right to some anchors.
content.protection: Bolts and a few pieces of gear
content.location: Ramp on the wall near its low point

content.description: Climb the corner between the ledge at the end of the wall and the ramp on the wall past a bolt to a bulge feature in the middle of the wall and follow 2 more bolts up passing some dike crystals then follow the upper easy ramp to anchors.
Climb the corner off the right side of the ramp going up to the ledge at the end of the crag and join the next route at the bulge feature in the middle of the wall.

The start can not be accessed safely without climbing Lizard People first and rappelling to start below a drop off in the creek canyon at anchors on the wall. There is also a fun toprope variation by bouldering to the right off the anchors to gain a fun easy corner up 20' or so.
content.location: Left of the current routes on the wall.

content.description: Climbs off the left end of the big ramp at the top of the wall, above Lizard People. Follow a corner in the end of the headwall with not great rock quality. Appears some bolts have been added possibly because of this.
content.protection: Gear, some bigger would help, and bolts
content.location: Downstream end of the ramp at the top of the wall
